articles.title: Coronavirus cases surpass 100,000 worldwide
articles.description: As coronavirus cases top 101,000 worldwide, at least 260 cases have been confirmed in the U.S. Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.title: Florida sees its first coronavirus-linked deaths
articles.description: There are now 347 confirmed coronavirus cases across 29 U.S. states. At least 17 people have died nationwide, the latest two fatalities coming from Florida. Meanwhile, 3,500 cruise passengers are stuck in limbo off the coast of California as 21 people on boar…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus threatens to have broad economic impact
articles.description: New jobs numbers released Friday show a decrease in the unemployment rate before the spread of coronavirus. Yahoo Finance reporter Akiko Fujita spoke to CBSN's Reena Ninan about the broader economic impact of the spreading disease.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: At CDC visit, Trump downplays number of U.S. coronavirus cases
articles.description: President Trump downplayed the number of U.S. coronavirus cases during his visit to CDC headquarters. Paula Reid reports.

articles.author: Li Cohen
articles.title: New York declares state of emergency amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: There are 76 confirmed COVID-19 cases in New York State, including 11 in New York City.
articles.content:
New York Governor Andrew Cuomo declared a state of emergency amid the coronavirus outbreak. Shortly before the announcement, he tweeted that there are now 76 confirmed cases of COVID-19 throughout the state, most of which are in Westchester County.   
As of … [+6097 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus updates: Florida reports first deaths on East Coast
articles.description: The number of confirmed cases worldwide continues to climb.
articles.content: Florida health officials announced late Friday that two people who tested positive for coronavirus have died – the first deaths on the East Coast linked to the virus. The Florida Department of Health said the two people had traveled overseas, but did not say … [+2069 chars]

articles.title: Eye Opener: Trump urges calm amid coronavirus panic
articles.description: Coronavirus cases spread to 29 U.S. states as President Trump urges “calm.” Also, Mr. Trump replaced acting Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney with loyalist GOP Rep. Mark Meadows. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener. Your world in 90 seconds.

articles.author: Sophie Lewis
articles.title: Facebook bans ads for face masks amid coronavirus panic
articles.description: "We're monitoring COVID19 closely and will make necessary updates to our policies if we see people trying to exploit this public health emergency."
articles.content: Facebook announced on Friday it is banning face mask ads and commerce listings from its platforms. "We are temporarily banning advertisements and commerce listings, like those on Marketplace, that sell medical face masks," the tech giant said in a statement. … [+3437 chars]

articles.title: Top Saudi royal family members detained
articles.description: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, King Salman's son who is considered the de facto ruler of the kingdom, has been consolidating power since ousting Mohammed bin Nayef as heir to the throne in 2017.
articles.content:
Reporting by Margaret Brennan
A U.S. official confirmed Saturday that top members of the Saudi royal family have been detained and the land bridge to Bahrain has also been closed. The official said the purpose and breadth of the security lockdown remains unc… [+1454 chars]
